value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI, you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module, you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. You then learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, so that others can see your insights and benefit from your work.

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Create dashboards in Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft Power BI dashboards are different than Power BI reports. Dashboards allow report consumers to create a single artifact of directed data that is personalized just for them.  Dashboards can be comprised of pinned visuals that are taken from different reports. Where a Power BI report uses data from a single dataset, a Power BI dashboard can contain visuals from different datasets.

value.title: Add calculated tables and columns to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to add calculated tables and calculated columns to your data model. You'll also be able to describe row context, which is used to evaluated calculated column formulas. Because it's possible to add columns to a table using Power Query, you'll also learn when it's best to create calculated columns instead of Power Query computed columns.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

value.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Evaluate shifts in work patterns with the Business continuity dashboard in Microsoft Workplace Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to set up and interpret the results from the Workplace Analytics Power BI Business continuity dashboard. Generate insights from the behavioral data to help navigate shifts in employee and team work patterns.

value.title: Measure Teams collaboration with the Teams insights dashboard in Workplace Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to prepare and generate useful data using the Workplace Analytics Power BI Teams insights dashboard.  Analyze Microsoft Teams adoption trends from the populated reports.

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.

value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.
